intro: Hemitelia obtusiloba, commonly known as the blunt-leaf hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with a rounded base. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
